These events were found by eye. A storm was defined as Dst < -40 nT. The Onset time was defined as taking the start of a negative slope in the Dst before the min. This was at time a bit arbitrary. The min Dst is just what it sounds like, the end of the hour where the Dst was at it's min. This was also some times a bit arbitrary when the Dst would dip back down after the first time it reached the min. value. The recovery phase is defined as 80% recovery from the min. Dst value. This is also at times a bit arbitrary when the Dst would almost recover and stay just below the 80% recovery level for hours (some times days) before the start of another storm and yet the previous one never technically recovered. These are all (hopefully) symantics and the times hopefully give us an honest view of the storms which occured during the CRRES mission. 


		onset				min				recovered		
year	month	day	hr	min	month	day	hour	min	month	day	hour	min
